text:
EXCLUSIVE
9708

A LESSON FOR "DEFENSE DAY" IN A N.Y. FORT.

The scene depicted above might well happen with the inadequate system of defense against attack from an enemy. The photo shows one of the great 12" inch rifles in Fort Wadsworth, Staten Island, in action against enemy ships beyond Sandy Hook. Other enemy ships have landed troops and tanks below the fortifications. Whippet tanks make a concerted against the unprotected rear and one climbing the parapet in front, fires with its one pounder on the unprotected gun crew and the few infantrymen with a machine gun and rifles. An adequate system of mobilization with the necessary equipment to prevent such an incident as this is one of the purposes of "Defense Day."

YOUR CREDIT LINE MUST READ: - (BY UNITED)
Sept. 13, 1924.

This photo is supplied by
United Newspictures, Inc.
title: Richmond:] Staten Island - Fort Wadsworth.

text:
Fort Wadsworth, United States Military Reservation (Staten Island): Shown is the main fortress guarding The Narrows, the water gate to the Upper New York Bay. The fort was named, in 1865, in honor of Brigadier General James S. Wadsworth, who was killed in the Battle of the Wilderness. The present defenses were built in 1847.

P. L. Sperr

Views 1,2: May 2, 1925
View 3: June 29, 1931

D3 : Negative # 3913
D4 : Negative # 3921
D5 : Negative # 3920

text:
Fort Wadsworth, United States Military Reservation (Staten Island), showing a portion of the old fort built in 1847. Shown, too, is the Lower New York Bay and the Dutch liner "Statendam."

P. L. Sperr

(2)

A pond in the military reservation, near Tompkins Avenue.

May 16, 1925

By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr
